doc.field: Aztec Ruins National Monument in Aztec, NM.
newmexico ruins aztec historic sanjuancounty aztecruins nationalmonumet
Aztec, New Mexico The ruins are the remains of a settlement built by the Pueblo Indians. It is only called "Aztec" due to the local town.
newmexico ruins aztec historic marker sanjuancounty aztecruins nationalmonumet
newmexico sign ruins aztec historic sanjuancounty aztecruins nationalmonumet
The Pueblo Indians constructed this elaborate settlement between 1000 and 1200. The settlement was abandoned by the late 1200's. The "Aztec" only comes from the nearby town.
newmexico ruins aztec pueblo historic sanjuancounty aztecruins nationalmonumet
The Pueblo Indians constructed this elaborate settlement between 1000 and 1200. The settlement was abandoned by the late 1200's. The "Aztec" only comes from the nearby town.
newmexico ruins pueblo historic nationalmonument aztecruins

Aztec Ruins National Monument The Pueblo Indians constructed this elaborate settlement between 1000 and 1200. The West Ruin at one time had over 500, 3 story rooms. The settlement was abandoned by the late 1200's. The "Aztec" only comes from the nearby town.
newmexico ruins pueblo historic nationalmonument aztecruins
The Pueblo Indians constructed this elaborate settlement between 1000 and 1200. The settlement was abandoned by the late 1200's. The "Aztec" only comes from the nearby town.
newmexico ruins aztec pueblo historic nationalmonument sanjuancounty aztecruins
The Pueblo Indians constructed this elaborate settlement between 1000 and 1200. The settlement was abandoned by the late 1200's. The "Aztec" only comes from the nearby town.
newmexico ruins aztec pueblo historic nationalmonument sanjuancounty aztecruins

The Pueblo Indians constructed this elaborate settlement between 1000 and 1200. The settlement was abandoned by the late 1200's. The doorways were constructed very narrow and short to prevent intruders from being able to run full speed into the rooms. The "Aztec" only comes from the nearby town.
newmexico ruins aztec pueblo historic nationalmonument sanjuancounty aztecruins

The Pueblo Indians constructed this elaborate settlement between 1000 and 1200. The settlement was abandoned by the late 1200's. The settlement had multiple small kiva like the one seen in the foreground. The "Aztec" only comes from the nearby town.
newmexico ruins aztec pueblo historic nationalmonument kiva sanjuancounty aztecruins

Aztec Ruins National Monument The Pueblo Indians constructed this elaborate settlement between 1000 and 1200. The settlement was abandoned by the late 1200's. The doorways were purposefully built short (less than 5 feet) so that no intruders could simply run full speed into the rooms. The "Aztec" only comes from the nearby town.
newmexico ruins pueblo historic nationalmonument aztecruins

The Pueblo Indians constructed this elaborate settlement between 1000 and 1200. The settlement was abandoned by the late 1200's. The great Kiva is a replica of the sanctuary constructed by the Pueblos. The "Aztec" only comes from the nearby town.
newmexico ruins pueblo historic nationalmonument kiva aztecruins

The Pueblo Indians constructed this elaborate settlement between 1000 and 1200. The settlement was abandoned by the late 1200's. The kiva was a site for meetings and sanctuary. They would be entered through the roof. The "Aztec" only comes from the nearby town.
newmexico ruins aztec pueblo historic nationalmonument sanjuancounty aztecruins

The Pueblo Indians constructed this elaborate settlement between 1000 and 1200. The settlement was abandoned by the late 1200's. The settlement had multiple small kivas which were sites of meeting and sanctuary. The "Aztec" only comes from the nearby town.
newmexico ruins aztec pueblo historic nationalmonument kiva sanjuancounty aztecruins

The Pueblo Indians constructed this elaborate settlement between 1000 and 1200. The settlement was abandoned by the late 1200's. The purpose of the green sandstone that runs along some walls of the West Ruin are a mystery. The "Aztec" only comes from the nearby town.
newmexico aztec pueblo nationalmonument greensandstone sanjuancounty aztecruins
